intro: Nassauvia glomerulosa f. typica, commonly known as the clustered nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, displaying drought tolerance and adapted to full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
